message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of depression and anxiety, and Escitalopram is commonly prescribed as a first-line treatment for both conditions in adolescents. Buspirone is typically used for anxiety disorders, but may not be effective for depression. Quetiapine is an antipsychotic and is not a first-line treatment for depression or anxiety. Venlafaxine is also an antidepressant but is not typically used as a first-line treatment in adolescents.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is displaying symptoms of depression and anxiety, with guilt over the divorce as a trigger. Escitalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) commonly used to treat depression and anxiety disorders in children and adolescents. Buspirone is a medication used for anxiety disorders, but it is not typically used for depression or in children under 18. Quetiapine and Venlafaxine are medications used primarily for bipolar disorder and major depressive disorder, respectively, and are not first-line treatments for this patient's symptoms.
